%---------... TO HERE
\begin{document}
\maketitle
\thispagestyle{fancy}

\begin{itemize}
	\item Aim to evaluate $\int f(\lambda; x, t)\frac{g(\lambda)}{h(\lambda)} d\lambda$ efficiently, for many $(x,t)$. Here calculating $g,h$ is expensive relative to $f$, so want to store evaluation of $g,h$.
	
	\item g, h are exponential polynomials, so their dominant terms (depending on where $\CC \mid \lambda$ is) can be isolated analytically before expensive evaluation of all non-dominant terms.
	
	\item Implementation in Julia.
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
